publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7731 Maureen Watt: Cash Boost for Aberdeen Pool—That the Parliament welcomes the donation of £100,000 from FirstGroup toward a 50-metre swimming pool for Aberdeen; notes that £20 million toward the cost of the pool has been secured from organisations such as the University of Aberdeen, Aberdeen City Council and sportscotland; believes that businesses have an important role to play in improving the quality of life of the communities in which they operate, and applauds the continued progress toward the delivery of a 50-metre pool for Aberdeen that has been made under the current Scottish administration. Supported by: Rob Gibson*, Stewart Stevenson*, Bill Kidd*, Kenneth Gibson*
S3M-7731 Cash Boost for Aberdeen Pool (lodged on 18 January 2011) Nanette Milne*, Stewart Maxwell*, Sandra White*, Brian Adam*

S3M-7731 Maureen Watt: Cash Boost for Aberdeen Pool—That the Parliament welcomes the donation of £100,000 from FirstGroup toward a 50-metre swimming pool for Aberdeen; notes that £20 million toward the cost of the pool has been secured from organisations such as the University of Aberdeen, Aberdeen City Council and sportscotland; believes that businesses have an important role to play in improving the quality of life of the communities in which they operate, and applauds the continued progress toward the delivery of a 50-metre pool for Aberdeen that has been made under the current Scottish administration. Supported by: Rob Gibson, Stewart Stevenson, Bill Kidd, Kenneth Gibson, Nanette Milne, Stewart Maxwell, Sandra White, Brian Adam
S3M-7731 Cash Boost for Aberdeen Pool (lodged on 18 January 2011) Stuart McMillan*
S3M-7731 Cash Boost for Aberdeen Pool (lodged on 18 January 2011) Gil Paterson*

S3M-7731 Maureen Watt: Cash Boost for Aberdeen Pool—That the Parliament welcomes the donation of £100,000 from FirstGroup toward a 50-metre swimming pool for Aberdeen; notes that £20 million toward the cost of the pool has been secured from organisations such as the University of Aberdeen, Aberdeen City Council and sportscotland; believes that businesses have an important role to play in improving the quality of life of the communities in which they operate, and applauds the continued progress toward the delivery of a 50-metre pool for Aberdeen that has been made under the current Scottish administration. Supported by: Rob Gibson, Stewart Stevenson, Bill Kidd, Kenneth Gibson, Nanette Milne, Stewart Maxwell, Sandra White, Brian Adam, Stuart McMillan, Gil Paterson
